backend/main.mo: Motoko canister storing predefined Q&A pairs and exposing getAnswer with basic matching plus a health check.
feature_evidence.json: Feature evidence report detailing branding‑replacement tasks, affected files, components, and test IDs.
frontend-file-summaries.txt: List of short summaries for all frontend components, content files, and configuration files.
frontend/docs/smoke-test-assistant.md: Smoke test checklist describing end‑to‑end validation steps for the AI Assistant feature.
frontend/index.css: Global Tailwind-based style definitions using OKLCH tokens for light and dark themes.
frontend/index.html: Main HTML entry with metadata, OG tags, favicon, and script mount point.
frontend/src/App.tsx: Top-level React app composing all marketing and assistant sections with header, footer, and health banner.
frontend/src/components/AssistantSection: Interactive assistant form handling questions, backend health gating, loading states, errors, and retries.
frontend/src/components/BackendHealthBan: Banner that displays a warning when backend health is reported as unhealthy.
frontend/src/components/CapabilitiesSect: Renders a capabilities section displaying categorized AI features with inputs, outputs, constraints, and tags using cards and badges.
frontend/src/components/ContactSection.t: Implements a contact form that constructs a mailto link on submit and displays a success alert, with input handling and submission state.
frontend/src/components/FAQSection.tsx: Displays a list of FAQs using an accordion component, each containing a question and answer about product usage and policies.
frontend/src/components/HeroSection.tsx: Shows the landing hero with headline, CTA buttons, and stats, including smooth scroll behavior to the contact section.
frontend/src/components/HowItWorksSectio: Presents workflow steps and safe testing practices using cards populated from content arrays.
frontend/src/components/SafetySecuritySe: Lists security features in card format, each with an icon, description, and detailed bullet points.
frontend/src/components/SiteFooter.tsx: Footer component with branding, navigation buttons that scroll to sections, and external links.
frontend/src/components/SiteHeader.tsx: Header with scroll detection, navigation buttons for section scrolling, and mobile menu handling.
frontend/src/components/TryDemoSection.t: Section displaying suggested demo prompts in cards and a link to launch the demo environment.
Displays industry-specific AI use cases with icons, descriptions, examples, and tags.
frontend/src/content/capabilities.ts: Exports a structured list of AI capability categories with detailed items and metadata.
frontend/src/content/howItWorks.ts: Defines workflow steps and safe testing practices for using the demo environment.
frontend/src/content/tryDemo.ts: Provides suggested prompt examples with expected outputs for trying the demo.
frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts: Creates and caches an authenticated or anonymous backend actor, and invalidates dependent queries when the identity changes.
frontend/src/hooks/useBackendHealth.ts: Checks backend health via the actor’s healthy() method and exposes a status with retry and interval polling.
frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.t: Provides Internet Identity context, manages AuthClient creation, login flow, stored identity, and status flags.
frontend/src/hooks/useQueries.ts: Defines a mutation for getAnswer that validates input, checks backend health, calls the actor, and sanitizes IC errors.
frontend/src/index.css: Tailwind setup defining government‑grade color variables, base styles, dark mode variants, and accessibility focus rules.
frontend/src/main.tsx: Bootstraps the app with React, setting up QueryClient and InternetIdentityProvider before rendering App.
frontend/src/utils/icErrors.ts: Detects IC replica rejection errors and returns sanitized user‑friendly messages while logging full details.
frontend/tailwind.config.js: Configures Tailwind theme extensions, color tokens from CSS variables, typography, container queries, and animations.
project_state.json: Tracks project state, requirements, branding updates, known issues, and deployment/assistant backend problems.
